website_summaries.verdict: Tilt and swivel as needed, thanks to this sturdy dual stand that enables seamless toggling between applications and programs, and also organizes unruly cables.
pros: Supports screens up to 24 inches wide and 33 pounds
Can adjust height up to 13 inches
Monitors can be adjusted to use in landscape or portrait mode
Although made of durable material, the stand itself is not overly heavy
cons: Takes time to adjust screens to correct placement
may not be a good fit for users who want the flexibility to move arms more often

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stand. Works excellent with two 24in monitors.Very durable construction.
customer_reviews.text: This Planar dual monitor stand rocks! It was easy to setup and the instructions were clear. The large base gives enough weight distribution on some Ikea desks like Linnmon. I put a post/leg under the Linnmon table to add more support. I used a 24in Benq gaming monitor and a 23.8 Asus monitor and they both balance perfectly. When I tilt/rotate either monitor, the stand doesn't move a inch. This thing is ROCK SOLID. The stand is well built to last a life time. If you do not want to bolt/clamp down a stand to your desk, then this is the stand you need. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Omer Saeed

customer_reviews.title: Good Stand, Especially for Tight Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Mounted my two 20-inch monitors (VX2035wm). Space is tight - it's up against a wall so no back overhang possible - and these have worked out very well. The monitors hold their positions, so no need to keep reseting or tightening. One note - there's not a lot of vertical play: At max height, the bottom of the monitors are only 5 inches off the desk and the middle of the screen is only 12 inches. Other stands on amazon have more adjustability. The footprint is pretty small, but does protrude about 3 1/2 inches from the monitor face. Still, it's not taking up a lot of desk space. Setup is rock solid stable - no wiggling.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not what I want (returned)
customer_reviews.text: OK, style wise it looks good. Assembly? Easy to put together. Problems? - mine came missing the allen wrench - luckily I had one that fit. - It wobbled a bit - not a lot but wasn't 100% secure. - I have two Dell u2410 monitors. The stands that come with them raise the monitors higher than this dual mount. Overall - if you have monitors with some of the stands that basically only lift your monitor an inch or two this is an improvement and looks decent. But I wasn't willing to lower my monitors to use this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Zed

customer_reviews.title: Well built and stable.
customer_reviews.text: This planar Dual Monitor Stand may take a few minutes to assemble, but it is well built, and will keep your monitors very stable. I bought two of these to mount 4 monitors, and it was much easier than a pole or wall mount system. I did not need to bolt or tie this stand down as the weight distribution was good, with a low center of gravity. The stand easily adjusts to a few different size monitors, and the basic cable management ring is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered and steady
customer_reviews.text: Dual monitors have become a must for me and this stand is very adjustable and secure. I have two 22" ViewSonic LED-lit LCD monitors on it and it will certainly take 24" versions of the same monitor. We used these stands in the business environment before I bought my own, utilizing heavier monitors, and there was never an issue with any of them. Easy to set up. Go to the trouble of laying the monitors flat on a desk during installation or vertical adjustments to avoid weight distribution related complications. If you are installing two new monitors, place the monitors face-down on the boxes they shipped in.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand is just what I needed for my desk. I ordered two 23" monitors and they worked great on this mount. You will be surprised by how simple this mount is. Simple in a good way. It is solidly built. I plan on recommending these to friends and buying more for work.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Well built, easy to adjust and assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these monitor stands for my department at work. We setup dual monitors for each workstation. They assemble easily and are very stable with the monitors mounted. Well designed with a solid bar design to keep monitors at the same level. Keep in mind that you need to have two of the same monitor in order for the monitors to line up evenly (alll monitors have different VESA mounting points).
customer_reviews.author: Terrell J

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor stand at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent monitor stand that we use throughout our office. All of our users have Planar dual, triple, and quad monitor stands. I've posted a video on YouTube showing them if anyone is interested (search for "Review of Planar dual, triple, and quad monitor stands"). Definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand does the job just fine. It is a sturdy stand, quality mounts, fully adjustable in every direction I need it to. I am a video producer and photographer and I do a lot of digital darkroom, pre/post pro and research. It's very handy having matching monitors on this sucker. Looks cleaner and takes less space. I have my monitors on top of the power amp for my speakers (I use a 5000w PA for my desk with subs, mids and tweeters) and there is no way I could have 2 monitor stands on it. This solves that problem well.
customer_reviews.author: W A R

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I debated between this model and the cheaper $40ish models you see on here. I can't tell you how happy I am I chose the Planer model. Sturdy, attractive, adjustable...done. I'm an IT professional by trade and I can say, this is the highest quality dual-monitor stand I have ever seen. For reference purposes, I have two LG Flatron E2242T 22.5" LED monitors mounted on them via the monitor's 75mmx75mm VESA mounting holes and the included VESA mounting plates/hardware (comes with the stand). Hardware installed easily with zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Purchased by Amazon.com recommendation and not disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Started looking for a second external monitor for my laptop docking station and realized I should have a stand to attach the monitors to. Looked high and low on Amazon for well-recommended products and everything had some "negative" that hit my "concerned" spot. Then buried deep in a review for another product I saw a recommendation by another member to "Try the Planar" version. I am GLAD I did!. This this is very sturdy (was a concern), easy to assemble (moderate concern), allows the screens to be "mobile" as I'd hope and just generally is a well-made product. Very please and I'd recommend you try it if looking for a monitor stand.
customer_reviews.author: Parise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent dual monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: I've been a dual monitor user for many years. Recently I upgraded to a couple of 23" Asus IPS monitors and purchased this stand to reduce footprint and increase versatility. The stand is very well made, easy to assemble and set up, and is very sturdy. The springs are heavy duty and, with the swingarms, offer maximum viewing options, no matter what 'scheme' you use for a dual setup. This is the best stand I've owned for dual monitors and highly suggest it to anyone looking for a well-made product that looks as good as it works.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and packaged well. Took about 15 minutes to set up. Assembled stand to monitors with monitors laying down. Then slide stand into mount and lifted the entire assembly onto my desk top stand. From there it was easy to adjust both monitors to a great viewing position. The monitors are very easy to adjust to other positions and there is a nice range of movement possible. The stand itself is very very sturdy and easily supports my 23 and 21 inch monitors. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Engel

customer_reviews.title: good, inexpensive stand for multiple monitors
customer_reviews.text: When I decided to mount both my home pc monitors on one stand to reduce the desktop footprint they use, eliminate the typical misalignment issue between multiple screens, and make cleaning my desk easier this is what I bought. I like it. It is reasonably well-made, cheap enough to buy, assemble, and adjust. It is not a rugged commercial item but it is fine for home users who want to neaten up their desks by consolidating two monitor stands into one. It is not be tough enough for serious business applications due to the level of machine work, but it works great for typical home use.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I freaking love this stand!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two 24" LCD monitors. I love having them both affixed to this stand. Very easy to install. Just be careful with the balancing act after you get the first one mounted. You may need your better half to provide a second set of hands. The footprint of this stand is not all that large. If your that worried about how much space this stand takes up, you probably don't need two monitors or should go with some type of wall mount, if possible. Love, love, love this stand!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim H.

customer_reviews.title: Planar Dual Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with 2 ASUS 24" monitors. The monitors are great, but the stands supplied were a bit on the shaky side - this stand corrected that problem - thanks to those who had reviewed the monitors and forewarned me. This stand is very stable and handles the 24"ers with no problem. Lots of adjustment capability so you can align the monitors the way you want them - can even have one monitor vertical while the other is horizontal.
customer_reviews.author: Fred A Neudecker

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and set up
customer_reviews.text: Solid stand, easy to assemble and set up. I mounted two 23" Lenovo monitors on it this and it works great. Only had in acouple weeks so will update as time goes by. Only thing i don't like is that I hit my mouse on the foot of the stand, but that is more an issue with my set up than the stand IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsylvania Husker

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant cause there was a much cheaper dual monitor stand available. But after using both, this is far superior and worth the extra price. Here is what I like about this product: -Has a much smaller footprint on your desk (takes up less space) -Very easy to adjust either monitor between portrait and landscape -Really easy to line up the monitors -The monitors have not sagged at all. Stand is quire secure.
customer_reviews.author: hamndrew

customer_reviews.title: Planar Dual Monitor Stand Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This stand was easy to assemble. Was very impressed with the machining of the parts and the overall construction of the stand. Our two 23" Asus Monitors attached quickly to the mounts. Like other have said when assembling monitors to the stand itself, have someone hold the stand or lay on flat surface, monitors face down. When the monitors are securely mounted, the stand works perfect. Very stable and with the two 23" Asus Monitors, has plenty of adjustment, both horizontal and vertical to work with. Monitors lined up just right, and looks very professional. Freed up lots of desk space. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: eTech

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure this could be a great monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: The supplied screws are not long enough to attach the mount to any of the ViewSonic, Asus, or Dell monitors I've tried to use this with. The screws include a locking washer. With the washer in place, the screws are about 1/16 inch too short to engage the threads in these monitors. The locking washer has too small an internal diameter to remove without stripping the threads. Overall, I'm sure this could be a great monitor stand, but it sucks until I go find and buy longer screws. Not what I expect from Planar.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent construction and easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent construction and easy to put together. If you follow the directions, it is not difficult to mount both monitors by yourself. The supports are heavy duty and can be positioned at many different angles. It has freed up much desktop space! I would recommend without reservation.
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Reviews were right, this one is the best
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on stands and this one seemed to have the best combination of good reviews and reasonable price. Glad I went with this one as it is easy to set up, super stable and perfect flexibility in viewing. If you have 24" screens it might be kind of tight if your screens have larger than average bezels surrounding the screen. Works great with my 23" Asus VS238H-P screens though.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gott

customer_reviews.title: Nice dual monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: We recently decided to install dual monitors for all the people in our office. We purchased 10 of these based on the recommendation of our tech support person and they have worked out real well. We installed Dell 19 monitors on the stands and they fit and worked great. The stand is very sturdy and hold the monitors very stable. For the price this is a pretty good stand.
customer_reviews.author: Drebit

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rolling on 24"
customer_reviews.text: You read that title right, a little hipster talk... I purchased two of these stands for me and my partner in the company and they work great. We have Dell 24inch monitors on each side, and it's completely balanced with no issues regarding tipping in any direction. There is one small item that the left monitor sits 1/4 inch higher than the right, but I'm sure if I took the time to adjust, I could get them balanced. Not enough of an issue to spend the time on.
customer_reviews.author: RU from CO

customer_reviews.title: Great Dual Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I used this with (2) 22" HP Wide Screen Monitors and it is a very good product, fairly small foot print and base does not take up too much space on your desk. It does have somewhat of a cable guide which is just ok, but build quality is excellent and fairly straightforward to put together and many adjustments in almost ever direction. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Osornio

customer_reviews.title: One screw messed up but still works
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor stand. The only problem I had with it is that one of the tiny screws that goes in to the base was messed up and would not screw in. But everything seems to work fine anyway. Also the picture instructions are awful. I'd sure like to see written instructions given as well as the pictures. But I did figure it out. Also I think unless you are very brave and strong, it takes two people to set up with the monitors.
customer_reviews.author: P. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dual Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I got this stand for my office at work and it has been a dream. The stand is very sturdy and has a large enough footprint that it doesn't wobble. I currently have two Acer 23" monitors side by side and it max's out the width. The finish is nice and matt and doesn't draw to much attention. The assembly wasn't to bad and if you have put together and other kind of furniture then this should be no problem. There is no flex or wobble in the monitors and they stay where I put them. Overall it's a great basic dual screen monitor stand. No regrets in buying this!
customer_reviews.author: Dutch422

customer_reviews.title: For the price I expected more
customer_reviews.text: I had two 23" monitors attached and it's very sturdy and surprisingly light-weight. Main negative is it sits a bit low and there's no real height adjustment available. Major adjustments such as sliding left and right and height are difficult or impossible but those are 1-time adjustments so that's not a major negative. Adjusting for angle and pitch is easy which is good because that's where the fine tuning is.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Its big!
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this as the feet were way to big and it forces the monitors to be off the wall by 6 inches. If I was using this on a corner desk, it would probably be fine but I had to use it against a wall and it took up to much real estate on my desk. It is very sturdy and did hold up the monitors well.
customer_reviews.author: Mitul Patel

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made Dual Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I have two (2) twenty-two inch Acer monitor s on this stand. Well-made and good assembly instructions. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Spiker

customer_reviews.title: A solid dual-monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Very solid and stable. - Easy to make adjustments. - Reduces desk footprint. Cons: - The documentation doesn't immediately make it clear as to which direction to install the monitor brackets. This lead to a fair amount of confusion when I was initially setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse D Harris

customer_reviews.title: No real issues
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand, it's great as long as you don't plan on moving your monitors much etc. The main problem I had with it is that it can be difficult to keep balanced before you get the second monitor on as the first tends to put too much weight on one side for it to stand up without being held up.
customer_reviews.author: Travis P

customer_reviews.title: best deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with this dual monitor stand. Easy to install, very strong constructions, well designed, and the best part: price. Cons: Not all 24" monitors will fit. I have 2x24" monitors, they have a thin plastic frame around the screen. They fitted perfectly in the stand. There are another type of monitos out there, where the plastic frame is thicker; I don't think 2 of them will fit in the stand.
customer_reviews.author: luisangel72

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two large monitors
customer_reviews.text: I have two large monitors, both 23" and this stand works nearly perfect. The only thing I had to do was put the stand on top of a small 4" box because I need my monitors to be a litter higher. I am very happy with this stand. It's not one of those big boxes that takes away desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Lois

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This does a good job of holding two monitors. I wish it were a little easier to adjust, but it's acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: SuperZMan

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have two ASUS 23" monitors attached to it, positioned at a slight angle. The monitors stay where I put them (I don't move them around much) and I don't worry about them tipping. Certainly while you are installing them you will want a second person to hold the stand while it is unbalanced with one monitor attached.
customer_reviews.author: David Slack

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and orient. I gined a lot of floor space on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Orestes Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor Stand
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these now, and will purchase a third for my office. Sturdy, easily assembled, opened some expensive real estate on my desktop and saved me some neck pain.
customer_reviews.author: vanoden

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: The stand accomplished what I wanted (hang two monitors side-by-side). It if very stable and looks great. I wish the pole had been slightly taller (1") but no big deal. Also as others pointed out 2x24" monitors is the limit the stand will handle (extreme end of the hanger arms), unfortunately this leaves little room for adjustment and specifically creating the v-shape I like, again no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Routh

customer_reviews.title: For 70 dollars you could at least make sure your parts work
customer_reviews.text: I use this stand at work, and have set up at least 6-7 of these already. When it works? It works great. Sturdy and adjustable, great for 24 inch monitors and below. However this is the second personal purchase of mine. I sent back one because one of arm holes for the tightening screw wasn't curt well enough. This time I got one with the tiny screw not being cut right as well, i'm able to use it with 2 of the tiny screws, but still, for 70 dollars you can make sure the parts are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Solid stand
customer_reviews.text: I've used two of these stands now and they're great. My only major gripe is that it's a bit awkward to adjust the height once the two monitors are mounted to the arms. Make sure you have the high where you want it because one the weight of the screens is on the arms, they're not going to move as easily.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Dieguez

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love that I don't have to deal with cumbersome monitor lifts. Nice quality and fairly easy to assemble. Just take 2 people to be sure the monitors are secure! We bought 6 for our office and we all love them! Only thing I would wish for was an easier adjustment to move up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey, eCommerce Customer Support Specialist

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely build and sits close to the wall which is what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good stands for dual monitors at work
customer_reviews.text: Good stands for dual monitors at work. Needs to be adjusted using some tools, but once it's adjusted, the monitors hold up the monitors well and allow easy tilt and slight swivel.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Impressive at Home and at Work
customer_reviews.text: Set this thing up once it arrived. I love how it holds my two 21" monitors. Makes a great and professional look. We use this same model at my workplace and they always impress.
customer_reviews.author: Justin V

customer_reviews.title: No way to adjust vertical tilt...unless I missed something.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stand for two Acer 23 inch monitors. Assembly was a breeze, and the stand was quite sturdy (hence the 2 star rating versus a single star). Once everything was assembled, I began positioning my monitors. I noticed that there was absolutely no way to adjust the vertical tilt, so both of my Acer monitors were angled slightly upward, toward the ceiling. Because of all of the positive reviews of this product, I will assume this is a result of poor VESA mount design on Acers part. Nonetheless, without the ability to adjust the vertical tilt, these stands lose major functionality points, IMO. So if you're considering this stand with an Acer setup, be warned.
customer_reviews.author: datboyaintright

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: This is exceptional. No need for clamps or bolting to the desk, It just works.
customer_reviews.author: G. C. Mason

customer_reviews.title: Solid, capable display stand
customer_reviews.text: I have this display stand holding two 24" widescreen monitors that are heavy as lead. It has performed admirably. With 24" screens, the amount of available adjustment is just enough to get them where I wanted. There wasn't a lot of extra room, but the stand delivered what the manufacturer said it would. Once the monitors are mounted, their weight makes adjustments difficult. This is definitely not something that you will play with regularly unless your screens are small. Once you get it set though, it is solid, stable, and reliable. I highly recommend this stand if you want to put dual, large-screen monitors on a desktop.
customer_reviews.author: DeekGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great dual monitor stand.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 of these so far now and have used 21", 23", and 24" monitors. I like that you can adjust the monitors horizontally - some monitor stands don't have that option. It's also very stable once you have it set up properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: meets my needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This stand holds my 2 monitors steady and at just the height that I want. I have no problem making minor adjustments as needed (based on what I'm doing, the optimal position changes.) It was easy to assemble and seems very sturdy. well worth the purchase price
customer_reviews.author: S. Wartell

customer_reviews.title: The ability to rotate the monitor is nice..
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says on the box and for this type of product that's all you can ask for. The ability to rotate the monitor is nice... and lowers the typical dual monitor desk footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Juanny

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand! I was a little concerned if this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Stand! I was a little concerned if this would fit my ASUS 24" IPS screens with enough angle, but they fit well and look fantastic. Quality aluminum construction and easy cable management. Only problem is I think I need three monitors!
customer_reviews.author: Netcam

customer_reviews.title: Planar 997-5253 dual monitor stand "Love it"
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy dual-monitor stand. I'm using 2 ASUS VS247 LCD 23-inch and they fit perfectly. I searched for several months at package electronic store, and couldn’t beat the best pricing here at amazon. Built to last construction, would definitely recommend to another buyer!
customer_reviews.author: BocaGuySoFLA

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and very sturdy. I have two of these, each with one horizontal 24'' and one vertical 24'' monitor, and have no complaints. Also, in comparison to some other monitor stands, there are rubber feet / pads on the bottom that prevents scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is the third or fourth one we have purchased as we convert all desk in our office to dual monitors everyone loves them
customer_reviews.author: Roy Frick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: light weight, easy to assemble and ideal for tight spaces. This stand actually sits on top of my docking station. It keeps the monitors at the proper height for maximum visibility. there are only 2 minor drawbacks: 1) if this device was resting on my desktop, the mounting post would be too short (by about 6"). 2) I have 2, 24" Dell monitors and although the angle of view is acceptable for me, others might prefer a sharper angle. Therefore the arms might need about 1" each to accomodate this requirement. Like I said, these drawbacks are kind of petty, so my rating is actually about a 4.5.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sardo

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand
customer_reviews.text: we origiannly bought one to try it...staff in office liked it so much we bought six more...would buy again and recommend...may need two people to get second monitor mounted (i mounted them all myslef but would have been easier if someone helping/holding)
customer_reviews.author: J. Hager

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stands.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stands. Professionally packed, sturdy and look great. I also have a 3 monitor mount that I've purchased from cinemassive and these are much sturdier and easier to put together than the overpriced cinemassive mounts. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: OldMcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and well built
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and well built. Definitely a tight fit for the advertised maximum size (24") monitor. I should have have paid the extra for the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Sealless

customer_reviews.title: Great product that works just like it should.
customer_reviews.text: The only way you should try to setup a desk-mounted dual monitor system. Works great for my 24" flat monitors.
customer_reviews.author: T. Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I only use 17" monitors and it works great holding both monitors. Very easy to setup, it does come disassembled. The stand has a very sturdy base. Also has multiple adjustments that i had not considered. Highly recommend this product!! Money well spent
customer_reviews.author: R. Garza

customer_reviews.title: Perfect LCD Stand for Dual Portrait
customer_reviews.text: Perfection. I've been using this for like 3 years with dual 24 inch LCD (by Dell) that are in portrait orientation. I could not be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Cory J. Trese

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: very stable base with 22" monitors. Make sure your monitors have a vesa mount, some don't. I have it in a desk corner, and it frees up a lot of desk space plus the screen center is closer to my eye and tri focal center.
customer_reviews.author: Villager Mike

customer_reviews.title: Price went up....
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this from amazon, it was shipped via [...] for under a [...]. Seems like price increased since then... must better deal at the old price ;-) When I purchased this, I was concerned about its ability to remain stable, but as long as you have 2 screens, stability is not a problem at all. Had a bit of difficulty with the installation, but otherwise pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel H. Geng

customer_reviews.title: Solid Products - Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. Solid construction. Holds two 21" Samsung LED Monitors attached to my Mac. The only weakness is the size of the base. It really kills the space on the desktop.
customer_reviews.author: ClanCian

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not the best
customer_reviews.text: Works very well to hold monitors stable, but the adjustment range is lacking. I prefer my other model that has arms which allow you to orient your screens at more of an angle.
customer_reviews.author: FWTX

customer_reviews.title: Great dual monitor stand
customer_reviews.text: Great dual monitor stand. The stand is very sturdy, with no wobble. It's very easy to adjust monitor positions and hights.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for dual monitors
customer_reviews.text: We have probably bought 30 or these here at our office and really like them. We use mostly 22" monitors but they will also accommodate 24" monitors. Sturdy and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Tango

customer_reviews.title: Love these things....
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these now, and I absolutely love them. Very sturdy and have lasted years with no problems. Nothing like having two 23" monitors to create a massive desktop.
customer_reviews.author: ICD

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money product.
customer_reviews.text: Solid, easy to assemble monitor stand at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Glen L

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it needs to do
customer_reviews.text: I have to Acer H213H (21") monitors on the stand. It works great. It was also very easy to set up and is easy to adjust. It has freed up a ton of space on my desk. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob LaBlaw

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: This stand has one of the lower prices, has lots of adjustments to get it just the way you want and it has a small foot print so it doesn't take up a lot of desk space.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

It took some time to get my two LCD monitors adjusted to the best viewing position but after that I've had no issues. If you have been resisting using multiple monitors (I know that I had been) you'll be pleasantly surprised at how much more efficient it is to work with multiple screens.

I then returned the stand because it was useless to me.

product_meta.title: Planar Dual Monitor Stand, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Dual Monitor StandPlanar's dual monitor stand maximizes the benefits of two monitors by making it easier to toggle between applications with the seamless display setup. The stand helps to organize displays cables with a cable organizer, and can tilt, swivel, rotate and height adjust. Also available in a large-format dual monitor stand for monitors 24"-32". Installation is quick and easy.
feature_bullets: The Regular Dual Monitor Stand supports two displays between 17-24" with maximum weight of 26 lbs. per display while the Large Dual Monitor Stand supports two displays between 24"-32".
Flexibility to tilt up and down +/- 15 Degree, Swivel displays side to side +/-20 Degree
Rotate 90 Degree for landscape or portrait mode
Hole pitch 100 mm x 100 mm VESA and 75 mm x 75 mm VESA
